name: df-oprab
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0
body: |- wceq(coprab(s0, s1, s2, w0), cab(s3, wex(s0, wex(s1, wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s3), cop(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(s2))), w0))))))
comment: Define the class abstraction (class builder) of a collection of nested ordered pairs (for use in defining operations). This is a special case of Definition 4.16 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 14. Normally ` x ` , ` y ` , and ` z ` are distinct, although the definition doesn't strictly require it. See ~ df-ov for the value of an operation. The brace notation is called "class abstraction" by Quine; it is also called a "class builder" in the literature. The value of the most common operation class builder is given by ~ ovmpt2 . (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1995.)
